metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1130 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Linux kernel before version 4.16-rc7 is vulnerable to a null pointer dereference in dccp_write_xmit() function in net/dccp/output.c in that allows a local user to cause a denial of service by a number of certain crafted system calls. It was discovered that a null pointer dereference vulnerability existed in the DCCP protocol implementation in the Linux kernel. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1130` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-127-generic - 4.4.0-127.153
linux-image-4.4.0-127-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-127.153
linux-image-4.4.0-127-lowlatency - 4.4.0-127.153
linux-image-4.4.0-127-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-127.153
linux-image-4.4.0-127-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-127.153
linux-image-4.4.0-127-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-127.153
linux-image-4.4.0-127-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-127.153
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-127-generic - 4.4.0-127.153
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-127.153').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1060.69').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1013.13~16.04.2').
linux-euclid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needed ESM criteria').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'abandoned').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1014.14~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needs-triage').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1026.31').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'abandoned').
